newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Andean Pact to begin Mercosur talks next week.
newsitem.headline: Andean Pact to begin Mercosur talks next week.

text.p: Andean Pact trade ministers will meet in Venezuela next week to discuss ways of forging a free-trade agreement with the Mercosur customs union, a senior Colombian official said Tuesday.
"We're going to begin conversing about the mechanisims and criteria for negotiations with Mercosur," Foreign Trade Minister Morris Harf said.

He said the talks would be held on the sidelines of an Andean Development Corporation meeting in Caracas and help lay the groundwork for a formal meeting of Andean Pact and Mercosur countries to be held in the near future in Peru.

Venezuelan Foreign Minister Miguel Angel Bureilli Rivas announced Monday in Cocbabamba, the Bolivian city where the so- called Rio Group of Latin American countries is holding its 10th presdiential summit, that the Andean Pact had agreed to negotiate a free-trade accord with Mercosur.
The Andean Pact groups Venezuela, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru and Bolivia while Mercosur -- South America's biggest trade bloc -- is comprised by Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay and Paraguay.
According to Harf, no free-trade accord between the two groups is likely to be completed before 1999.
"We don't want to rush into negotiations," Harf said, noting that it took Chile about two years to negotiate its own free- trade agreement with Mercosur.
